commit_message:
update documentation

Change-Id: I0a3dd67587ac0c78cd9f2a77aee1fe1b917c5f4a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/58/238558/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Quick installation ================== #. Install the prerequisite packages. On Ubuntu (tested on 14.04-64):: sudo apt-get install python-dev libssl-dev python-pip git-core libmysqlclient-dev libffi-dev On Fedora-based distributions e.g., Fedora/RHEL/CentOS/Scientific Linux (tested on CentOS 6.5):: sudo yum install python-virtualenv openssl-devel python-pip git gcc libffi-devel mysql-devel postgresql-devel On openSUSE-based distributions (SLES 12, openSUSE 13.1, Factory or Tumbleweed):: sudo zypper install gcc git libmysqlclient-devel libopenssl-devel postgresql-devel python-devel python-pip #. Install watcher modules from pip:: sudo pip install python-watcher Configure Watcher =================#. Create the Watcher service user (eg ``watcher``) and set a password. The service uses it to authenticate with the Identity Service. Set KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PROJECT_NAME, your Keystone `service project name`_ and keystone user-role-add --user=watcher --tenant=KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PROJECT_NAME --role=admin or:: keystone service-create --name=watcher --type=infra-optim --description="Infrastructure Optimization service" or:: openstack service create --name watcher infra-optim #. Create the endpoints by replacing YOUR_REGION and WATCHER_API_IP with your region and your Watcher Service's API node URLs:: --adminurl=http://WATCHER_API_IP:9322 or::.. _`service project name`: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/configuringservices.html#. In MySQL, create a ``watcher`` database that is accessible by the with the real password::----------------------------- address of the RabbitMQ server::#. Configure the Watcher Service to use these credentials with the Identity Service. Replace IDENTITY_IP with the address of the Keystone Identity server, KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PROJECT_NAME by the Keystone service project name, and WATCHER_PASSWORD with the password you chose for the ``watcher`` admin_password=WATCHER_PASSWORDDevelopment installation ======================== We propose different ways to quickly install Watcher for development: * `DevStack and Docker`_ * `Virtualenv`_ .. _DevStack and Docker: ./install-devstack-docker.rst .. _Virtualenv: ./virtualenv.rst
deleted_lines: ======================== Development Installation ======================== Watcher development uses virtualenv to track and manage Python dependencies while in development and testing. This allows you to install all of the Python package dependencies in a virtual environment or “virtualenv”, instead of installing the packages at the system level. Linux Systems ------------- Install the prerequisite packages. On Ubuntu (tested on 12.04-64 and 14.04-64):: sudo apt-get install python-dev libssl-dev python-pip git-core libmysqlclient-dev libffi-dev On Fedora-based distributions e.g., Fedora/RHEL/CentOS/Scientific Linux (tested on CentOS 6.5):: sudo yum install python-virtualenv openssl-devel python-pip git gcc libffi-devel mysql-devel postgresql-devel On openSUSE-based distributions (SLES 12, openSUSE 13.1, Factory or Tumbleweed):: sudo zypper install gcc git libmysqlclient-devel libopenssl-devel postgresql-devel python-devel python-pip Manually installing and using the virtualenv -------------------------------------------- If you have `virtualenvwrapper <https://virtualenvwrapper.readthedocs.org/en/latest/install.html>`_ installed:: $ mkvirtualenv watcher $ git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/stackforge/watcher $ cd watcher && python setup.py install $ pip install -r ./requirements.txt To run a specific test, use a positional argument for the unit tests:: # run a specific test for Python 2.7 tox -epy27 -- tests.api You may pass options to the test programs using positional arguments:: # run all the Python 2.7 unit tests (in parallel!) tox -epy27 -- --parallel To run only the pep8/flake8 syntax and style checks:: tox -epep8 #. Create the Watcher service user (eg ``watcher``). The service uses this to authenticate with the Identity Service. Use the ``service`` project and keystone user-role-add --user=watcher --tenant=service --role=admin or keystone service-create --name=watcher --type=infra-optim \ --description="Infrastructure Optimization service" or openstack service create --name watcher infra-optim #. Create the endpoints by replacing YOUR_REGION and WATCHER_API_IP with your region and your Watcher Service's API node:: --adminurl=http://WATCHER_API_IP:9322 or#. In MySQL, create an ``watcher`` database that is accessible by the with the actual password::============================= address of the RabbitMQ server.::#. Configure the Watcher Service to use these credentials with the Identity Service. Replace IDENTITY_IP with the IP of the Identity server, and replace WATCHER_PASSWORD with the password you chose for the ``watcher`` admin_password=WATCHER_DBPASSWORD#. Start the Watcher Service:: watcher-api && watcher-decision-engine && watcher-applier =============== Important notes =============== #. Watcher must have admin role on supervized users' projects created on your IAAS, in order to be able to migrate project's instances if required by Watcher audits: keystone user-role-add --user=watcher --tenant=<USER_PROJECT_NAME> --role=admin or openstack role add --project <USER_PROJECT_NAME> --user watcher admin #. Please check also your hypervisor configuration to handle correctly instance migration: `OpenStack - Configure Migrations <http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/content/section_configuring-compute-migrations.html>`_

added_lines: OpenStack Watcher provides a flexible and scalable resource optimization service for multi-tenant OpenStack-based clouds. Watcher provides a complete optimization loop—including everything from a metrics receiver, complex event processor and profiler, optimization processor and an action plan applier. This provides a robust framework to realize a wide range of cloud optimization goals, including the reduction of data center operating costs, increased system performance via intelligent virtual machine migration, increased energy efficiency—and more!
deleted_lines: Watcher takes advantage of CEP and ML algorithms/metaheuristics to improve physical resources usage through better VM placement. Watcher can improve your cloud optimization by reducing energy footprint and increasing profits.

subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 12:10:00.000000000', 'files': ['tools/filter_git_history.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/aac30bf211753ea17871ef80bfa3285c5a5ec08f', 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I3c87987d3b992c8363ef236a04ae6e35c1315535
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I3c87987d3b992c8363ef236a04ae6e35c1315535
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
handle routers without an external gateway in list_router_interfaces

list_router_interfaces would fail if called on a router with no external
gateway:

    File "/home/lars/.ansible/tmp/ansible-tmp-1445525437.55-149961620412652/os_router", line 343, in main
      ports = cloud.list_router_interfaces(router, 'internal')
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/shade/__init__.py", line 1922, in list_router_interfaces
      ext_fixed = router['external_gateway_info']['external_fixed_ips']
    TypeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute '__getitem__'

This commit defaults `ext_fixed` to an empty list if there is no external gateway.

Change-Id: Idbcd5f005ebef47e11377e83a60d2adea7c3380b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/52/238552/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ext_fixed = (router['external_gateway_info']['external_fixed_ips'] if router['external_gateway_info'] else [])
deleted_lines: ext_fixed = router['external_gateway_info']['external_fixed_ips']

commit_message:
Lookup parent network for floating range by CIDR

Floating range was always considered as subrange within Public network of default node group.
Now, lookup of parent network for floating range by CIDR is implemented.
So, floating range may match any Public network of a cluster.

Co-Authored-By: Aleksei Kasatkin <akasatkin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I7d8b0c1db0835aec9e035177e076e40f4e793902
Closes-Bug: #1502829

commit_message:
Use nginx proxy for packages before netconfig

When we use multirack topology then right after provisioning all
nodes from non-default node-group have default route set to their
rack router IP. So in case of isolated admin network (when local
package mirrors and/or Internet are not accessible via admin net)
such nodes won't be able to download and install any packages
until we configure all the interfaces (management, public, etc).
And network configuration itself requires some OVS packages.
In order to solve this issue we setup nginx proxy on Fuel master
node and configure Apt to use it. We remove it after netconfig
task.

Integration tests disabled since they won't pass until we merge
Ida30b5de9f730821ae969032019adf409cfa82ca and upload ISO with it
to CI slave nodes.
Fuel-CI: disable

Change-Id: I7d729a1ca6c602b033e697c26ca7ce3f429849dc
Closes-bug: #1497378

subject: Setup nginx proxy for packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 21:41:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/a2d2fcaaa9b612101fcc6e51f74be7755b3e9b1b', 'message': "Setup nginx proxy for packages before netconfig

When we use multirack topology then right after provisioning all
nodes from non-default node-group have default route set to their
rack router IP. So in case of isolated admin network (when local
package mirrors and/or Internet are not accessible via admin net)
such nodes won't be able to download and install any packages
until we configure all the interfaces (management, public, etc).
And network configuration itself requires some OVS packages.
In order to solve this issue we setup nginx proxy on Fuel master
node and configure Apt to use it. We remove it after netconfig
task.

Change-Id: Ida30b5de9f730821ae969032019adf409cfa82ca
Closes-bug: #1497378
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-22 21:51:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/3b41463b317051328eb047fb1f8eddaa756f00ba', 'message': "Setup nginx proxy for packages before netconfig

commit_message:
Setup nginx proxy for packages

Run nginx proxy on Fuel master node on port 2080. This proxy is
used by nodes so they could download and install packages before
network is fully configured and mirrors are directly accessible
from the nodes.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ida30b5de9f730821ae969032019adf409cfa82ca
Partial-bug: #1497378

commit_message:
Rename ironic/tests/unit/unit_base.py to base.py

Rename unit_base.py to base.py. This could not be done in one commit as
we would lose our git history for the original base.py file.

commit_message:
[doc] Improve devstack plugin installation docs

Improve layout, add links to devstack, mention cfapi service.
Replace github references with git.openstack.org references.
Also removes unnecessary enable_service instructions in cfapi docs, to
be consistent with plugin documentation

Change-Id: I0235db31fe8dd80ada1a627a9d02e61d1236488f
Related-Bug: #1506232

commit_message:
If-None-Match header removed from container

If-None-Match support was added to “Create container” and “Create
Object” on assuming the context of commit message title. Above
parameter has been deleted from container Api-docs as per
Developer’s suggestion.

Change-Id: I87bd2126a1f4b8db86d8908470539d59de9419ef
Partial-bug: #1400794

commit_message:
Shared File Systems API: removed 'local' network_type

A valid value of the network_type is VLAN, VXLAN, GRE, or flat.
The 'local' value was removed.

(df) Updated links in share files to relative links.

Change-Id: I7725f246dfd0ba452817f25a24c4ad760aaf0cdc
Closes-Bug: #1507616

commit_message:
Remove config-drive and server-usage section in v2.1 compute API doc

v2.1 compute API doc now contains servers section. The current
config-drive and server-usage section can be removed as they
are already included in the servers section.

(df) Add response parameters for list server details and
show server details calls.
(df) Consolidated the server actions into one section and added
response parameter descriptions.
(df) Updated the links at the top of the Compute v2.1 page
to be in alphabetical order, and to put all extensions at end of the page.
This is what triggered refactoring of the server actions. Also, some of
the page-level links were incorrect. I fixed those.

Co-Authored-By: Diane Fleming <diflemin@cisco.com>

Change-Id: I0cbcd2c219c68b3331d5221679412813e5be507c
Closes-Bug: #1506699

commit_message:
Fixed name for test run for Tempest results

We are going to use new name pattern for test runs,
need to use 'kilo' prefix for reports.

Change-Id: I5a91546ab6c77bc53267bb2a12dafc2bf1bb5a50
Closes-Bug: #1506779

Unable to create the media repository." msgstr "" "NV-5F976E2 가상 광학 매체를 저장할 볼륨 그룹 %(vol_grp)s을(를) " "찾을 수 없습니다. 매체 저장소를 작성할 수 없습니다." #: nova_powervm/virt/powervm/exception.py:44 #, python-format msgid "Expected to find exactly one management partition; found %(count)d." msgstr "" "NV-5E41059 정확히 하나의 관리 파티션을 찾을 것을 예상했지만 " "%(count)d개를 찾았습니다." #: nova_powervm/virt/powervm/exception.py:50 #, python-format msgid "" "Having scanned SCSI bus %(bus)x on the management partition, disk with " "UDID %(udid)s failed to appear after %(polls)d polls over %(timeout)d " "seconds." msgstr "" "NV-0611C68 관리 파티션에서 SCSI 버스 %(bus)x을(를) 스캔한 경우 " "UDID가 %(udid)s인 디스크가 %(timeout)d초 이상 %(polls)d 폴링한 후" "표시되지 못했습니다." #: nova_powervm/virt/powervm/exception.py:57 #, python-format msgid "" "Expected to find exactly one disk on the management partition at " "%(path_pattern)s; found %(count)d." msgstr "" "NV-042142B %(path_pattern)s의 관리 파티션에서 정확히 하나의 디스크를 찾을 것을 예상했지만" "%(count)d개를 찾았습니다." #: nova_powervm/virt/powervm/exception.py:63 #, python-format msgid "" "Device %(devpath)s is still present on the management partition after " "attempting to delete it. " "Reason: %(reason)s" msgstr "" "인스턴스 '%(name)s'의 실시간 마이그레이션이 준비되지 않았으므로 실패했습니다. subject: Add document about default config filename
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-22 15:27:20.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health/commit/0bd549bd315af581e955305e1b9cfa39a2023e13', 'message': "Add document about default config filename

The default config file path and name is hard-coded but not documented.
So people don't know the default file path and name without reading the
code. So this commit adds the document as a NOTE.

Change-Id: I44598ebcafefa63e717cbecb3353f03e9344eff0
"}]
commit_message:
Add document about default config filename

The default config file path and name is hard-coded but not documented.
So people don't know the default file path and name without reading the
code. So this commit adds the document as a NOTE.

Change-Id: I44598ebcafefa63e717cbecb3353f03e9344eff0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health refs/changes/70/238570/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NOTE: The default config_file is "/etc/openstack-health.conf".

subject: Fix indendation bug in virtual environment setup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-22 12:35:03.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/environments/virtual.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs/commit/65c30195cfb7fee2c7848f809e4748b6fe242f94', 'message': 'Fix indendation bug in virtual environment setup

The section with instack-virt-setup has the last few notes in one
big rhel satellite registration block because indentation.

Change-Id: Iae903ad26bb61915c662cc4cb34221e2cbc78208
'}]
commit_message:
Fix indendation bug in virtual environment setup

The section with instack-virt-setup has the last few notes in one
big rhel satellite registration block because indentation.

Change-Id: Iae903ad26bb61915c662cc4cb34221e2cbc78208
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/80/238480/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. admonition:: Ceph :class: ceph To use Ceph you will need at least one additional virtual machine to be provisioned as a Ceph OSD; set the ``NODE_COUNT`` variable to 3, from a default of 2, so that the overcloud will have exactly one more:: export NODE_COUNT=3 .. note:: The ``TESTENV_ARGS`` environment variable can be used to customize the virtual environment configuration. For example, it could be used to enable additional networks as follows:: export TESTENV_ARGS="--baremetal-bridge-names 'brbm brbm1 brbm2'" :: instack-virt-setup If the script encounters problems, see :doc:`../troubleshooting/troubleshooting-virt-setup`.
deleted_lines: .. admonition:: Ceph :class: ceph To use Ceph you will need at least one additional virtual machine to be provisioned as a Ceph OSD; set the ``NODE_COUNT`` variable to 3, from a default of 2, so that the overcloud will have exactly one more:: export NODE_COUNT=3 .. note:: The ``TESTENV_ARGS`` environment variable can be used to customize the virtual environment configuration. For example, it could be used to enable additional networks as follows:: export TESTENV_ARGS="--baremetal-bridge-names 'brbm brbm1 brbm2'" :: instack-virt-setup If the script encounters problems, see :doc:`../troubleshooting/troubleshooting-virt-setup`.

subject: [install] link to the Liberty config reference
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-22 14:26:26.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/glance.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/8e7059dfb867fef3fbca6573ceee8c219c2cf959', 'message': '[install] link to the Liberty config reference

At the moment in "Add the Image service" we link to the trunk version of
the config reference which redirects to the Liberty config reference at
the moment. We should directly link the Libery config reference to not
use the Mitaka config reference with the Liberty install guide in the
future.

Change-Id: I4fbcf8791ecde078a8ce9dd7a46947c6dd7ac5c0
'}]
commit_message:
[install] link to the Liberty config reference

At the moment in "Add the Image service" we link to the trunk version of
the config reference which redirects to the Liberty config reference at
the moment. We should directly link the Libery config reference to not
use the Mitaka config reference with the Liberty install guide in the
future.

Change-Id: I4fbcf8791ecde078a8ce9dd7a46947c6dd7ac5c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/33/238533/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: `Configuration Reference <http://docs.openstack.org/liberty/
deleted_lines: `Configuration Reference <http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/

subject: Move rally.osclients.Clients to plugin base
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-12 16:56:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/587cec4375db37f3ce99150c9e13f5cb1bd06366', 'message': 'WIP: rewrite rally.osclients.Clients class

Current implementation is not flexible. In near future(I suppose it will
be done in next patch) an ability of setting clients versions will be added.
Each client have each own validation(nova supports microversions, designate
accepts only str values of version, zaqar accepts only int values and etc).
Moving from method for client initialization to classes allows to implement
unique validations when it required.

Also, this patch unify usage of designateclient: use
designateclient.client.Client entry-point instead of hardcoded versioned
module.

TODO:
 * fix unit tests

Change-Id: Iefe2edf2be97708fe761624711a62cdcd109ccc3
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-12 19:23:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/16d4be1cd1e688f494487ad64ed4b45a752e452c', 'message': 'WIP: rewrite rally.osclients.Clients class

Current implementation is not flexible. In near future(I suppose it will
be done in next patch) an ability of setting clients versions will be added.
Each client have each own validation(nova supports microversions, designate
accepts only str values of version, zaqar accepts only int values and etc).
Moving from method for client initialization to classes allows to implement
unique validations when it required.

Also, this patch unify usage of designateclient: use
designateclient.client.Client entry-point instead of hardcoded versioned
module.

TODO:
 * fix unit tests

Change-Id: Iefe2edf2be97708fe761624711a62cdcd109ccc3
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-13 11:04:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/2a60ec3b320b780ce2fa8bf6aab466d73d60b28b', 'message': 'WIP: rewrite rally.osclients.Clients class

Current implementation is not flexible. In near future(I suppose it will
be done in next patch) an ability of setting clients versions will be added.
Also, the same situation with service types.

Each client have each own validation(nova supports microversions, designate
accepts only str values of version, zaqar accepts only int values and etc).
Moving from method for client initialization to classes allows to implement
unique validations when it required.

Also, this patch unify usage of designateclient: use
designateclient.client.Client entry-point instead of hardcoded versioned
module.

TODO:

commit_message:
Move rally.osclients.Clients to plugin base

Current implementation is not flexible. In near future(I suppose it will
be done in next patch) an ability of setting clients versions will be added.
Also, the same situation with service types.

Each client have each own validation(nova supports microversions, designate
accepts only str values of version, zaqar accepts only int values and etc).
Moving from method for client initialization to classes(Plugin-based) allows
to implement unique validations when it required.

Also, this patch unify usage of designateclient: use
designateclient.client.Client entry-point instead of hardcoded versioned
module.

Change-Id: Iefe2edf2be97708fe761624711a62cdcd109ccc3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/27/233727/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class BaseOSClient(object): DEFAULT_VERSION = 0 DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = None def __init__(self, aggregator, use_cache=True): self.aggregator = aggregator self.use_cache = use_cache @property def endpoint(self): return self.aggregator.endpoint def get_version(self, version): # most clients maps string value of version to versioned module, so we # should return str obj return str(version or self.aggregator.versions.get(self.__name__.lower(), self.DEFAULT_VERSION)) def init_client(self, *args, **kwargs): pass def __call__(self, *args, **kwargs): key = "{0}{1}{2}".format(self.__name__.lower(), if self.use_cache and key in self.aggregator.cache: return self.aggregator.cache[key] instance = self.init_client(*args, **kwargs) if self.use_cache: self.aggregator.cache[key] = instance return instance class _Nova(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = "2" DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = "compute" def init_client(self, version=None): """Return nova client.""" from novaclient import client as nova kc = self.aggregator.keystone() compute_api_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type=self.DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE, endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) client = nova.Client(self.get_version(version), auth_token=kc.auth_token, http_log_debug=logging.is_debug(), timeout=CONF.openstack_client_http_timeout, insecure=self.endpoint.insecure, cacert=self.endpoint.cacert, **self.aggregator._get_auth_info( password_key="api_key")) client.set_management_url(compute_api_url) return client class _Keystone(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = None DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = _Nova @staticmethod def _create_keystone_client(args): from keystoneclient import discover as keystone_discover discover = keystone_discover.Discover(**args) for version_data in discover.version_data(): version = version_data["version"] if version[0] <= 2: from keystoneclient.v2_0 import client as keystone_v2 return keystone_v2.Client(**args) elif version[0] == 3: from keystoneclient.v3 import client as keystone_v3 return keystone_v3.Client(**args) raise exceptions.RallyException("Failed to discover keystone version " "for url %(auth_url)s.", **args) def init_client(self): """Return keystone client.""" new_kw = { "timeout": CONF.openstack_client_http_timeout, "insecure": self.endpoint.insecure, "cacert": self.endpoint.cacert } kw = self.endpoint.to_dict() kw.update(new_kw) client = self._create_keystone_client(kw) if client.auth_ref is None: client.authenticate() return client class _Neutron(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = "2.0" DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = "network" def init_client(self, version=None): """Return neutron client.""" from neutronclient.neutron import client as neutron kc = self.aggregator.keystone() network_api_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type=self.DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE, endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) client = neutron.Client(self.get_version(version), token=kc.auth_token, endpoint_url=network_api_url, timeout=CONF.openstack_client_http_timeout, insecure=self.endpoint.insecure, ca_cert=self.endpoint.cacert, **self.aggregator._get_auth_info( project_name_key="tenant_name") ) return client class _Glance(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = "1" DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = "network" def init_client(self, version=None): """Return glance client.""" import glanceclient as glance kc = self.aggregator.keystone() image_api_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type="image", endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) client = glance.Client(self.get_version(version), endpoint=image_api_url, token=kc.auth_token, timeout=CONF.openstack_client_http_timeout, insecure=self.endpoint.insecure, cacert=self.endpoint.cacert) return client class _Heat(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = "1" DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = "orchestration" def init_client(self, version=None): """Return heat client.""" from heatclient import client as heat kc = self.aggregator.keystone() orchestration_api_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type=self.DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE, endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) client = heat.Client(self.get_version(version), endpoint=orchestration_api_url, token=kc.auth_token, timeout=CONF.openstack_client_http_timeout, insecure=self.endpoint.insecure, cacert=self.endpoint.cacert, **self.aggregator._get_auth_info( project_name_key=None)) return client class _Cinder(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = "1" DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = "volume" def init_client(self, version=None): """Return cinder client.""" from cinderclient import client as cinder client = cinder.Client(self.get_version(version), http_log_debug=logging.is_debug(), timeout=CONF.openstack_client_http_timeout, insecure=self.endpoint.insecure, cacert=self.endpoint.cacert, **self.aggregator._get_auth_info( password_key="api_key")) kc = self.aggregator.keystone() volume_api_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type="volume", endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) client.client.management_url = volume_api_url client.client.auth_token = kc.auth_token return client class _Manila(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = "1" DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = "share" def init_client(self, version=None): """Return manila client.""" from manilaclient import client as manila manila_client = manila.Client( self.get_version(version), region_name=self.endpoint.region_name, http_log_debug=logging.is_debug(), timeout=CONF.openstack_client_http_timeout, insecure=self.endpoint.insecure, cacert=self.endpoint.cacert, **self.aggregator._get_auth_info(password_key="api_key", project_name_key="project_name")) kc = self.aggregator.keystone() manila_client.client.management_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type=self.DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE, endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) manila_client.client.auth_token = kc.auth_token return manila_client class _Ceilometer(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = "2" DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = "metering" def init_client(self, version=None): """Return ceilometer client.""" from ceilometerclient import client as ceilometer kc = self.aggregator.keystone() metering_api_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type=self.DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE, endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) auth_token = kc.auth_token if not hasattr(auth_token, "__call__"): # python-ceilometerclient requires auth_token to be a callable auth_token = lambda: kc.auth_token client = ceilometer.get_client( self.get_version(version), os_endpoint=metering_api_url, token=auth_token, timeout=CONF.openstack_client_http_timeout, insecure=self.endpoint.insecure, cacert=self.endpoint.cacert, **self.aggregator._get_auth_info(project_name_key="tenant_name")) return client class _Ironic(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = "1" DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = "baremetal" def init_client(self, version=None): """Return Ironic client.""" from ironicclient import client as ironic kc = self.aggregator.keystone() baremetal_api_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type="baremetal", endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) client = ironic.get_client(self.get_version(version), os_auth_token=kc.auth_token, ironic_url=baremetal_api_url, timeout=CONF.openstack_client_http_timeout, insecure=self.endpoint.insecure, cacert=self.endpoint.cacert) return client class _Sahara(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = "1.1" def init_client(self, version=None): """Return Sahara client.""" from saharaclient import client as sahara client = sahara.Client(self.get_version(version), **self.aggregator._get_auth_info( password_key="api_key", project_name_key="project_name")) return client class _Zaqar(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = "1.1" DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = "messaging" def get_version(self, version): # zaqarclient accepts only int or float obj as version return float(super(_Zaqar, self).get_version(version)) def init_client(self, version=None): """Return Zaqar client.""" from zaqarclient.queues import client as zaqar kc = self.aggregator.keystone() messaging_api_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type=self.DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE, endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) conf = {"auth_opts": {"backend": "keystone", "options": { "os_username": self.endpoint.username, "os_password": self.endpoint.password, "os_project_name": self.endpoint.tenant_name, "os_project_id": kc.auth_tenant_id, "os_auth_url": self.endpoint.auth_url, "insecure": self.endpoint.insecure, }}} client = zaqar.Client(url=messaging_api_url, version=self.get_version(version), conf=conf) return client class _Murano(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = "1" DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = "application_catalog" def init_client(self, version=None): """Return Murano client.""" from muranoclient import client as murano kc = self.aggregator.keystone() murano_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type=self.DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE, endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name ) client = murano.Client(self.get_version(version), endpoint=murano_url, token=kc.auth_token) return client class _Designate(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = "1" DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = "dns" def init_client(self, version=None): """Return designate client.""" from designateclient import client kc = self.aggregator.keystone() dns_api_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type=self.DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE, endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) client = client.Client( self.get_version(version), endpoint=dns_api_url, token=kc.auth_token, insecure=self.endpoint.insecure) return client class _Trove(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_VERSION = "1.0" def init_client(self, version=None): """Returns trove client.""" from troveclient import client as trove client = trove.Client(self.get_version(version), region_name=self.endpoint.region_name, timeout=CONF.openstack_client_http_timeout, insecure=self.endpoint.insecure, cacert=self.endpoint.cacert, **self.aggregator._get_auth_info( password_key="api_key") ) return client class _Mistral(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = "workflowv2" def init_client(self, version=None): """Return Mistral client.""" from mistralclient.api import client kc = self.aggregator.keystone() mistral_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type=self.DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE, endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) client = client.client(mistral_url=mistral_url, service_type=self.DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE, auth_token=kc.auth_token) return client class _Swift(BaseOSClient): DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE = "object-store" def init_client(self): """Return swift client.""" from swiftclient import client as swift kc = self.aggregator.keystone() object_api_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type=self.DEFAULT_SERVICE_TYPE, endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) client = swift.Connection(retries=1, preauthurl=object_api_url, preauthtoken=kc.auth_token, insecure=self.endpoint.insecure, cacert=self.endpoint.cacert, **self.aggregator._get_auth_info( user_key="user", password_key="key", auth_url_key="authurl", project_name_key="tenant_name") ) return client class _EC2(BaseOSClient): def init_client(self): """Return ec2 client.""" import boto kc = self.aggregator.keystone() if kc.version != "v2.0": raise exceptions.RallyException( _("Rally EC2 benchmark currently supports only" "Keystone version 2")) ec2_credential = kc.ec2.create(user_id=kc.auth_user_id, tenant_id=kc.auth_tenant_id) ec2_api_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type=consts.ServiceType.EC2, endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) client = boto.connect_ec2_endpoint( url=ec2_api_url, aws_access_key_id=ec2_credential.access, aws_secret_access_key=ec2_credential.secret, is_secure=self.endpoint.insecure) return client def __init__(self, endpoint, versions=None): self.versions = versions or {} self.ceilometer = _Ceilometer(self) self.cinder = _Cinder(self) self.designate = _Designate(self) self.ec2 = _EC2(self) self.glance = _Glance(self) self.heat = _Heat(self) self.ironic = _Ironic(self) self.keystone = _Keystone(self) self.manila = _Manila(self) self.mistral = _Mistral(self) self.murano = _Murano(self) self.neutron = _Neutron(self) self.nova = _Nova(self) self.sahara = _Sahara(self) self.swift = _Swift(self) self.trove = _Trove(self) self.zaqar = _Zaqar(self) if "services_data" not in self.cache: services_data = {} ks = self.keystone() available_services = ks.service_catalog.get_endpoints() for stype in available_services.keys(): if stype in consts.ServiceType: services_data[stype] = consts.ServiceType[stype] self.cache["services_data"] = services_data return self.cache["services_data"] Decorated class will be added to Clients in runtime, so its sole ... class SuperNova(osclients.BaseOSClient): ... DEFAULT_VERSION = "2" ... ... def init_client(self, version=None): ... from novaclient import client as nova ... return nova.Client(self.DEFAULT_VERSION, ... auth_token=self.keystone().auth_token, ... **self._get_auth_info(password_key="key")) def wrap(client_cls): if not isinstance(client_cls, BaseOSClient): raise exceptions.RallyException( _("%s should be an instance of " "rally.osclients.BaseOSClient") % client_cls) setattr(cls, client_name, client_cls) return client_cls
deleted_lines: def cached(func): """Cache client handles.""" def wrapper(self, *args, **kwargs): key = "{0}{1}{2}".format(func.__name__, if key not in self.cache: self.cache[key] = func(self, *args, **kwargs) return self.cache[key] return wrapper def create_keystone_client(args): from keystoneclient import discover as keystone_discover discover = keystone_discover.Discover(**args) for version_data in discover.version_data(): version = version_data["version"] if version[0] <= 2: from keystoneclient.v2_0 import client as keystone_v2 return keystone_v2.Client(**args) elif version[0] == 3: from keystoneclient.v3 import client as keystone_v3 return keystone_v3.Client(**args) raise exceptions.RallyException( "Failed to discover keystone version for url %(auth_url)s.", **args) def __init__(self, endpoint): @cached def keystone(self): """Return keystone client.""" new_kw = { "timeout": CONF.openstack_client_http_timeout, "insecure": self.endpoint.insecure, "cacert": self.endpoint.cacert } kw = self.endpoint.to_dict() kw.update(new_kw) client = create_keystone_client(kw) if client.auth_ref is None: client.authenticate() return client @cached def nova(self, version="2"): """Return nova client.""" from novaclient import client as nova kc = self.keystone() compute_api_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type="compute", endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name) client = nova.Client(version, auth_token=kc.auth_token, http_log_debug=logging.is_debug(), timeout=CONF.openstack_client_http_timeout, insecure=self.endpoint.insecure, cacert=self.endpoint.cacert, **self._get_auth_info(password_key="api_key")) client.set_management_url(compute_api_url) endpoint_url=network_api_url, timeout=CONF.openstack_client_http_timeout, insecure=self.endpoint.insecure, ca_cert=self.endpoint.cacert, **self._get_auth_info( project_name_key="tenant_name") ) return commit_message:
Fix date format passed to dbapi

There was some rest endpoint method which wasn't parsing start and stop
date format before calling dbapi method. It was causing warning because
these fields were not in same format as run_at db field. This change
implement the _parse_datetimes call properly where was missing.

It was necessary update the timestamp variable on tests because the
dbapi call is made regardless minutes and seconds.

Change-Id: I3bb4cf4d1efebad0b81926a400dc91c8b647b4fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health refs/changes/53/237353/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ensure each plugin is linked to appropriate sec guidance doc

This commit ensures that each plugin which is related to a
secure development guidelines item mentions it in the links
section.

  https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/

Change-Id: If40aff98fa32e2fbff0eceef793e3e593ab981cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bandit refs/changes/96/237596/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adding metrics and CSS styling to HTML formatter

This commit adds a metrics summary to the top of the HTML report.
It also adds some CSS styling to the report to make it a bit more
visually appealing.

Change-Id: Id45d122afcc9ef897fac34d687d6af779ab89386
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bandit refs/changes/07/238507/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: DVR: notify specific agent when create/update port
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-08 09:20:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/29e1fa16ac5e3f271af3dc1353e6dfd71d14a993', 'message': "DVR: notify specific agent when create/update port

Now in DVR scenario, if we create a VM in one subnet
which has added to a DVR router, neutron-server will
firstly schedule this router to all related l3 agents,
then send 'routers_updated' RPC message to these l3
agents, in large scale, there is a serious performance
problem.
This patch makes two changes in DVR:
1. if a l3 agent in one compute node has not bind to a DVR
   router, when we create a VM in this compute node, we just
   schedule the router for this l3 agent, and just send
   'routers_updated' RPC message to this l3 agents.
2. if a l3 agent in one compute node has bind to a DVR router,
   when we create a VM in this compute node, we just need to send
   'routers_updated' RPC message to this l3 agents.

Change-Id: Idc7f3b9537d12a232c02d48a18f010506bb0b52e
Closes-bug: #1486795
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-08 11:27:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/605822110317d2d79f7068682a8bed4417b46bc6', 'message': "DVR: notify specific agent when create/update port

Now in DVR scenario, if we create a VM in one subnet
which has added to a DVR router, neutron-server will
firstly schedule this router to all related l3 agents,
then send 'routers_updated' RPC message to these l3
agents, in large scale, there is a serious performance
problem.
This patch makes two changes in DVR:
1. if a l3 agent in one compute node has "unbinded" from
   the existing DVR router, when we create first VM in this
   compute node, we just schedule the router for this l3 agent,
   and just send 'routers_updated' RPC message to this l3 agent.
2. if a l3 agent in one compute node has bind to a DVR router,
   when we create first VM in this compute node, we just need to
   send 'routers_updated' RPC message to this l3 agent.

Change-Id: Idc7f3b9537d12a232c02d48a18f010506bb0b52e
Closes-bug: #1486795

commit_message:
DVR: notify specific agent when create/update port

Now in DVR scenario, if we create a VM in one subnet
which has added to a DVR router, neutron-server will
firstly schedule this router to all related l3 agents,
then send 'routers_updated' RPC message to these l3
agents. In large scale, there is a serious performance
problem.
This patch makes two changes in DVR:
1. if a l3 agent in one compute node has unbound to
   the existing DVR router, when we create first VM in this
   compute node, we just need to schedule the router for this
   l3 agent, and send 'routers_updated' RPC message to this l3 agent.
2. if a l3 agent in one compute node has bind to a existing DVR router,
   when we create a VM in this compute node, we will not send
   'routers_updated' RPC message to any l3 agent, just send add_arp_entry
   message.

Change-Id: Idc7f3b9537d12a232c02d48a18f010506bb0b52e
Closes-bug: #1486795

commit_message:
Notify specific agent when create or update port

The L3 agent was determined when create or update port.
So notify the specific agent rather than notify all agents.
This will save some RPC resources.

Change-Id: I40aa9d9492e582168f4e9e57a138791946c89f8a
Close-Bug: #1486795

commit_message:
This adds baseline filtering to bandit

You can now provide bandit with a previous output report, in JSON
format. If given we will use this report to filter results. Results
will only be reported when the number of issues detected in a file
is not the same as the number that was detected in the baseline run.
If there is a discrepancy then all issues from the file will be
reported as we cant reliably determin the spoecific new issues
found.

Change-Id: Ia24ee665892ae59d7904776b9ff2637364ead213
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bandit refs/changes/56/238456/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: [Reports] Reduce histogram charts weight to make report faster
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-21 11:20:07.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/processing/charts.py', 'tests/unit/task/processing/test_charts.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/c003d8746710f1497ea90a830db1212da2fed2b1', 'message': "[Reports] Reduce histogram charts weight to make report faster

This patch removes histogram view `One Half', which seems to be
rarely used but holds a lot of data for JavaScript.

For example, there is a listing of how much data is generated for
JavaScript by MainHistogram, on dummy scenario with 50000 iterations:

   Square Root Choice - 224 points
   Sturges Formula - 17 points
   Rice Rule - 74 points
   One Half - 25000 points!!!

Removing this view causes HTML report to work much more faster.
In some cases (like given above) this actually revives the report.

Change-Id: I6f51e72b93084f57eaf8cc5a107a0dd103824944
"}]
commit_message:
[Reports] Reduce histogram charts weight to make report faster

This patch removes histogram view `One Half', which seems to be
rarely used but holds a lot of data for JavaScript.

For example, there is a listing of how much data is generated for
JavaScript by MainHistogram, on dummy scenario with 50000 iterations:

   Square Root Choice - 224 points
   Sturges Formula - 17 points
   Rice Rule - 74 points
   One Half - 25000 points!!!

Removing this view causes HTML report to work much more faster.
In some cases (like given above) this actually revives the report.

Change-Id: I6f51e72b93084f57eaf8cc5a107a0dd103824944

commit_message:
Use noop octavia driver for minimal job too

Seems like without the driver being set, octavia attempts to run the
load balancer in an amphora, and it fails for some reason to transit the
object into ACTIVE state.
Also remove the amphora boot related gate settings.

Change-Id: I1eb239ff18fb7ad77d0839f725029a703bd14982
Closes-Bug: #1505932

commit_message:
Sort projects by percentages of failure.

The projects now will be displayed ordered by the percentage of
failures.
That might help having people fixing this projects first.

Change-Id: Ie9b5d12840ecc5890b2dc880612c3d94d9ea47b9

commit_message:
Add a tests view

This commit adds a tests view to the dashboard, it has a bar graph
for all tests showing the failure rate and then a table listing the
per test stats for each test. This is a good starting point for
diving down into per test details.

Co-Authored-By: Glauco Oliveira <gvinici@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Caio Carrara <ccarrara@thoughtworks.com>
Change-Id: I56938734775c603cf5bac4f082d6dfae290dfbd0

commit_message:
Add functional_creds.conf to .gitignore

This patch adds two files to .gitignore.
*  `functional_creds.conf` is used for functional test
* `functional-tests.log` is generated by functional test

Change-Id: Ie21e8e20078770746117a8976444d9a72fd45d55
Closes-Bug: #1508797

commit_message:
Make openstack module tests work under puppet 4

This change updates the rsyslog default for the custom config option to
be '' rather than undef so that the correct file is used for the client
and service configurations under puppet 4. Additionally this change
fixes the parameter check for rabbit_hosts for the openstack module so
that it passes.

Change-Id: I128abd4cc27297d76db8f6d05e583cfbeae8abc7
Closes-Bug: #1507614

commit_message:
Fix the timeout arg for the su_rabbit_cmd

And fix local bashisms as a little bonus
Upstream patch https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/pull/374

Related-bug: #1464637

Change-Id: I13189de9f8abce23673c031d11132e495e1972e3
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/22/235422/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local timeout="/usr/bin/timeout ${OCF_RESKEY_command_timeout} $2" ${timeout} ${cmd}"
deleted_lines: local timeout=$2 ${COMMAND_TIMEOUT} ${cmd}"

commit_message:
Create Rakefile to execute lint and spec tasks

This change creates a top level Rakefile that can be used to run all of
the lint, syntax and spec tasks for the modules and files in this
repository.

This is needed to integrate with the openstack-infra puppet syntax and
unit test jobs.

This change disables the unit tests for l23network until they can be
fixed as part of bug 1507742.

Change-Id: I1f637f2f2fd91ce01ba2a92f6ea45499def5333d
Related-Bug: #1507751
Related-Bug: #1507742

commit_message:
The exception type is wrong and makes the except block not work

According to the context, it should be KeyError here to catch.
AttributeError will not happen here. More details could be found
in the bug report.

Change-Id: Id6351172703ac492e86475f75bf1be03f4e4e8a3
Closes-bug: #1506934
(cherry picked from commit 9d6584120003f50782461677d1b783bd07131444)

deleted_lines: except AttributeError:

commit_message:
Add coverage reports to tests

This change adds simplecov to show the coverage of the noop test files
and also includes the output from the rspec-puppet reports into the
coverage/ folder.

The simplecov report is a report that is merged together based on the
entire noop test run. It will show where we have astute.yaml gaps for
our given noop spec tests.

The rspec-puppet reports are named based on the astute.yaml file that
was used to generate each report.

Change-Id: I9dda550c960fb2742f1f0862305e144a3fb1d9d6
Closes-Bug: #1506557
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/32/235532/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: gem 'rspec-puppet', '~> 2.2.0' gem 'simplecov', :require => false
deleted_lines: gem 'rspec-puppet', '~> 2.0.0'

commit_message:
Prevent parallel execution of some dockerctl subcommands

The commit causes dockerctl to fail if another instance of script
is already running a container-changing function, i.e. export, start,
destroy, backup and restore. A global variable is used to allow
high-level functions like backup correctly re-use the lock for start
or destroy functions.

Change-Id: I5dc99adeacb901f11ea576674b4fdc64868b8784
Closes-bug: 1386578
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/92/234192/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function lock { local fd="$1" local exec="exec ${fd}>/var/lock/dockerctl" eval $exec flock -n $fd || { echo 'Failed to acquite the lock.' &>2; exit 1; } } function unlock { local fd="$1" flock -u "$fd" } function build_image { lock 802 unlock 802 lock 804 unlock 804 } lock 806 unlock 806 lock 807 unlock 807 lock 803 unlock 803 lock 801 unlock 801 unlock 801 lock 805 unlock 805 unlock 805
deleted_lines: function build_image {}

Initial set of tests for docker module

This change includes an initial test setup for the docker module and
ensures that runing 'rake lint' will pass.

Change-Id: I6f7fcf5241f078528a5429b1d6b9a3b8a6e02ee0
Related-Bug: #1507751
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/16/237216/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'puppetlabs_spec_helper/module_spec_helper' require 'shared_examples' RSpec.configure do |c| c.alias_it_should_behave_like_to :it_configures, 'configures' c.alias_it_should_behave_like_to :it_raises, 'raises' end at_exit { RSpec::Puppet::Coverage.report! }

commit_message:
Initial set of tests for cobbler module

This change includes an initial test setup for the cobbler module and
ensures that running 'rake lint' will pass.

Change-Id: I575483d8f36fcd236fd81ec012b16b44900b9960
Related-Bug: #1507751
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/12/237212/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'cobbler' do let(:default_params) { { :server => facts[:ipaddress], :production => 'prod', :domain_name => 'local', :name_server => facts[:ipaddress], :next_server => facts[:ipaddress], :dns_upstream => '8.8.8.8', :dns_domain => 'domain.tld', :dns_search => 'domain.tld', :dhcp_start_address => '10.0.0.201', :dhcp_end_address => '10.0.0.254', :dhcp_netmask => '255.255.255.0', :dhcp_gateway => facts[:ipaddress], :dhcp_interface => 'eth0', :cobbler_user => 'cobbler', :cobbler_password => 'cobbler', :pxetimeout => 0, :extra_admin_nets => {} } } shared_examples_for 'cobbler configuration' do let :params do default_params end context 'with default params' do let :params do default_params.merge!({}) end it 'configures with the default params' do should contain_class('cobbler') should contain_class('cobbler::packages') should contain_class('cobbler::selinux') should contain_class('cobbler::iptables') should contain_class('cobbler::snippets') should contain_class('cobbler::server').with( :domain_name => params[:domain_name], :production => params[:production], :dns_upstream => params[:dns_upstream], :dns_domain => params[:dns_domain], :dns_search => params[:dns_search], :extra_admins_net => params[:extra_admins_nets]) should contain_cobbler_digest_user(params[:cobbler_user]).with( :password => params[:cobbler_password]) end end context 'with production = docker' do let :params do default_params.merge!({ :production => 'docker' }) end it 'configures with the default params' do should contain_class('cobbler') should contain_class('cobbler::packages') should contain_class('cobbler::selinux') should_not contain_class('cobbler::iptables') should contain_class('cobbler::snippets') should contain_class('cobbler::server').with( :domain_name => params[:domain_name], :production => params[:production], :dns_upstream => params[:dns_upstream], :dns_domain => params[:dns_domain], :dns_search => params[:dns_search], :extra_admins_net => params[:extra_admins_nets]) should contain_cobbler_digest_user(params[:cobbler_user]).with( :password => params[:cobbler_password]) end end end context 'on Debian platforms' do let :facts do @default_facts.merge({ :osfamily => 'Debian', :operatingsystem => 'Debian', }) end it_configures 'cobbler configuration' end context 'on RedHat platforms' do let :facts do @default_facts.merge({ :osfamily => 'RedHat', :operatingsystem => 'RedHat', }) end it_configures 'cobbler configuration' end end

commit_message:
Move CN in OpenStack public endpoint certificate to SAN

As recommended by RFC2818, RDN and email part of CN moved to SAN in
certificate for public OpenStack endpoints in case of self-signing.

Change-Id: Iaf8a949bf35e599842fe3a8a045f9140e442a380
Closes-Bug: #1507806

commit_message:
Fix ssh dir mocks

Prior to this change if the root user's home directory was not /root,
the tests would fail due to improper mocking of the file system. This
change updates the order in which the directories are created and
ensures that we use the environment's user directory rather than
assuming /root.

Change-Id: I558e3b9971346a741d6409b3a8f00005e99eae3e
Closes-Bug: #1508124

Hashmap UI rework

Refactor code to use Horizon's classes
Refactor forms inheritance
Add mixin to order form fields
Populate group list in mappings and thresholds forms

subject: Modify instructions for using delorean to build images
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-15 20:32:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs/commit/8b6f29d26a76eab2367061b5142dc651c7c34c62', 'message': 'Modify instructions for using delorean to build images

By using DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF to build them images rather
than the delorean-repo element, yum-plugin-priorities does
not get installed in the overcloud images. The NVR of delorean
packages is not perfect, and sometimes there will be older
packages with a newer NVR in the deps repo. Until we can make
delorean always have newer NVR than any released package, we
rely on yum-plugin-priorities to always get the delorean
package over the released package.

Change-Id: I1c314c8532d9541c50836aad3a27222c85c5addf
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-19 13:02:23.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/basic_deployment/basic_deployment_cli.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs/commit/8a05522f3e224e2aec0c1d54ca95fd08014fa7c5', 'message': 'Modify instructions for using delorean to build images

By using DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF to build the images rather
than the delorean-repo element, yum-plugin-priorities does
not get installed in the overcloud images. The NVR of delorean
packages is not perfect, and sometimes there will be older
packages with a newer NVR in the deps repo. Until we can make
delorean always have newer NVR than any released package, we
rely on yum-plugin-priorities to always get the delorean
package over the released package.

Change-Id: I1c314c8532d9541c50836aad3a27222c85c5addf
'}]
commit_message:
Modify instructions for using delorean to build images

By using DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF to build the images rather
than the delorean-repo element, yum-plugin-priorities does
not get installed in the overcloud images. The NVR of delorean
packages is not perfect, and sometimes there will be older
packages with a newer NVR in the deps repo. Until we can make
delorean always have newer NVR than any released package, we
rely on yum-plugin-priorities to always get the delorean
package over the released package.

Change-Id: I1c314c8532d9541c50836aad3a27222c85c5addf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/75/235575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Images built from the latest repo that has passed CI can be found `here`_.. _here: https://repos.fedorapeople.org/repos/openstack-m/rdo-images-centos-liberty/ #. Install the current-tripleo delorean repo and deps repo into the overcloud images: export USE_DELOREAN_TRUNK=1 export DELOREAN_TRUNK_REPO="http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current-tripleo/" export DELOREAN_REPO_FILE="delorean.repo" Sample output of the command:: Source the ``overcloudrc`` file:: source ~/overcloudrc Create a directory for Tempest (eg. naming it ``tempest``):: mkdir ~/tempest cd ~/tempest Tempest expects the tests it discovers to be in the current working directory. Set it up accordingly:: /usr/share/openstack-tempest-liberty/tools/configure-tempest-directory The ``~/tempest-deployer-input.conf`` file was created during deployment and contains deployment specific settings. Use that file to configure Tempest:: tools/config_tempest.py --deployer-input ~/tempest-deployer-input.conf \ --debug --create \ identity.uri $OS_AUTH_URL \ identity.admin_password $OS_PASSWORD Run Tempest:: tools/run-tests.sh
deleted_lines: If you already have images built, perhaps from a previous installation of |project|, you can simply copy those image files into your regular user's home directory and skip this section. If you do this, be aware that sometimes newer versions of |project| do not work with older images, so if the deployment fails it may be necessary to delete the older images and restart the process from this step.#. Use undercloud delorean repos to build the overcloud images: export DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF="/etc/yum.repos.d/delorean.repo /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-deps.repo".. admonition:: Virtual :class: virtual When deploying the Compute node in a virtual machine, add `--libvirt-type qemu` or launching instances on the deployed overcloud will fail. To verify the Overcloud by running Tempest:: openstack overcloud validate --overcloud-auth-url $OS_AUTH_URL \ --overcloud-admin-password $OS_PASSWORDTo run only a part of the Tempest test suite (eg. tests with ``smoke`` tag):: openstack overcloud validate --overcloud-auth-url $OS_AUTH_URL \ --overcloud-admin-password $OS_PASSWORD \ --tempest-args smoke

commit_message:
Use identity_uri instead of auth_uri parameter

auth_uri parameter is not required. Services should only use
identity_uri for inter-cluster operations.

Closes-bug: #1503725
Change-Id: I83850bfe8d422b4ad93e58852524cdb114fcf326

commit_message:
Add `@ngInject` annotation to project `resolve` config.

During production builds, the minifier modifies variable names,
breaking Angular's automatic dependency injection. The ng-annotate
declaration `@ngInject` was missing from the `resolve` config
for the project route, causing all `/project/` paths to become
inaccessible. This adds the correct annotation to solve the issue.

Change-Id: I06505a8b7f1d74066872d60b5675524845a561fe

commit_message:
WIP: Enable boot volume attach

This is an example of how to attach a boot volume. I expect
to change it to make intellegent use of bdms. Other safety
checks based on bdms will be added seperately.

This change allows attachment of a bootable volume to a shutdown
instance if the volume we are trying to attach is the volume used to
boot the instance.

If that check passes then the volume is attached as the root device of
the instance.

Co-Authored-By: Andrea Rosa <andrea.rosa@hp.com>

blueprint detach-boot-volume

Change-Id: I84b76791f4460cad78f4e4db1d58b86f4b3cd77b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/23/223723/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def is_boot_volume_attached(bdms): return any(map(lambda x: x['boot_index'] == 0, bdms)) def get_device_name_for_bootable_vol(bdms, instance): if is_boot_volume_attached(bdms): raise exception.BootableVolumeAlreadyAttached( instance_id=instance['uuid']) return instance['root_device_name'] def get_device_name_for_instance(instance, bdms, device, bdm_as_boot=False): if bdm_as_boot: return get_device_name_for_bootable_vol(bdms, instance)
deleted_lines: def get_device_name_for_instance(instance, bdms, device):

subject: WIP: Allow boot volume detach when shutdown
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-15 17:48:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_volumes.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/volumes.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/volumes.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/799479518184a22cc1f07ff1021740e2b8b020a8', 'message': 'WIP: Allow boot volume detach when shutdown

This is an example to demonstrate detaching a boot volume. I expect
to change the implementation to make intellegent use of bdms. I
will add other safety checks based on bdms seperately.

It is safe to detach a root disk when a VM is in a stable shutdown
state (vm_state=stopped, power_state=shutdown, task_state=None).
However, currently there is a check in the API that blocks any
attempt to detach a root disk. This patch changes that check so
that it is only applied if the VM is not in that shutdown state.

blueprint detach-boot-volume

Change-Id: I6a781d1648d23f391830d7460a5aaca82f1b5eba
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Allow boot volume detach when shutdown

This is an example to demonstrate detaching a boot volume. I expect
to change the implementation to make intellegent use of bdms. I
will add other safety checks based on bdms seperately.

It is safe to detach a root disk when a VM is in a stable shutdown
state (vm_state=stopped, power_state=shutdown, task_state=None).
However, currently there is a check in the API that blocks any
attempt to detach a root disk. This patch changes that check so
that it is only applied if the VM is not in that shutdown state.

blueprint detach-boot-volume

Change-Id: I6a781d1648d23f391830d7460a5aaca82f1b5eba

commit_message:
Shared File Systems API: removed info about Quota Classes

Removed the information about quota classes (and the API requests)
in the Shared File Systems API, because the quota classes are not
used in the Shared File Systems service and are not working properly
for the current moment (in Liberty release and all releases earlier).

Change-Id: I9e5ead6af1c09feb27088d7f9898c1959af32e1c
Closes-Bug: #1508882

commit_message:
rabbit: shuffle hosts before building kombu URL

This restores behavior as it was back in the Juno cycle.  This was
changed in a refactor during the Kilo cycle (973301aa) when the kombu
failover_strategy was set to shuffle.  But the failover_strategy only
affects failovers; it does not influence which host receives the
initial connection.

Thus, if multiple hosts are given, the first host will receive all of
the initial connections.  By shuffling the hosts before building the
URL given to kombu, rudimentary load balancing is achieved and
connections are more evenly spread across broker nodes.

Change-Id: Ieecaf5f286f49302db29df9854359ef5d36b7a89
(cherry picked from commit f2beb5eaf158f76cdb8be0ca72965503be423ee2)

commit_message:
V-3869{2,4}: Lock inactive accounts

Implements: blueprint security-hardening

Change-Id: I96ff7de8398c1fb60c73e169e597dd354121c05e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/55/233255/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: **Opt-in required** By default, Ubuntu doesn't require that inactive accounts are locked after a period of time. The STIG requires that accounts with 35 days of activity are locked. Deployers must opt-in for this change by setting the ``inactive_account_lock_days`` Ansible variable. The STIG requires this to be set to 35 days at a maximum. The Ansible tasks will not make any changes to ``/etc/default/useradd`` unless ``inactive_account_lock_days`` is set.

commit_message:
Implement new map_merge intrinsic function

Adds a new map_merge function for Mitaka which can be used
to merge maps. Values in latter maps override those in earlier
ones.

Also, creates a new HOT template version for Mitaka which includes
the new map_merge function.

Implements: blueprint map-merge-function
Change-Id: I2bdfc70d04a4fa14cefcf928ea5947fbe7529cf9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/63/236663/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: hot_mitaka_tpl_empty = template_format.parse(''' heat_template_version: 2016-04-08 ''') def test_merge(self): snippet = {'map_merge': [{'f1': 'b1', 'f2': 'b2'}, {'f1': 'b2'}]} tmpl = template.Template(hot_mitaka_tpl_empty) resolved = self.resolve(snippet, tmpl) self.assertEqual('b2', resolved['f1']) self.assertEqual('b2', resolved['f2']) def test_merge_none(self): snippet = {'map_merge': [{'f1': 'b1', 'f2': 'b2'}, None]} tmpl = template.Template(hot_mitaka_tpl_empty) resolved = self.resolve(snippet, tmpl) self.assertEqual('b1', resolved['f1']) self.assertEqual('b2', resolved['f2']) def test_merge_invalid(self): snippet = {'map_merge': [{'f1': 'b1', 'f2': 'b2'}, ['f1', 'b2']]} tmpl = template.Template(hot_mitaka_tpl_empty) exc = self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.resolve, snippet, tmpl) self.assertIn('Incorrect arguments', six.text_type(exc)) def test_merge_containing_repeat(self): snippet = {'map_merge': {'repeat': {'template': {'ROLE': 'ROLE'}, 'for_each': {'ROLE': ['role1', 'role2']}}}} tmpl = template.Template(hot_mitaka_tpl_empty) resolved = self.resolve(snippet, tmpl) self.assertEqual('role1', resolved['role1']) self.assertEqual('role2', resolved['role2'])

subject: Avoid division operation in shell
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-22 09:40:28.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/897ec591e4d36da3c105944d92bfb7a94339727a', 'message': "Avoid division operation in shell

When the data returned from 'rabbitmqctl list_queues' grows a lot
and awk sums up all the rows especially for memory calculation it
returns the sum in scientific notation (example from bug
was .15997e+09), later when we want to calculate the memory in
MB instead of bytes, the bash division does not like this string.

We can just avoid the situation by doing the division into MB
in awk itself. Since we don't need the memory in bytes anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1503331
Change-Id: I38d25406b84d0f70ed62101d5fb5ba108bcab8bd
(cherry picked from commit 00a6a016d5235de4cbde26cb40db71119967d3c7)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid division operation in shell

When the data returned from 'rabbitmqctl list_queues' grows a lot
and awk sums up all the rows especially for memory calculation it
returns the sum in scientific notation (example from bug
was .15997e+09), later when we want to calculate the memory in
MB instead of bytes, the bash division does not like this string.

We can just avoid the situation by doing the division into MB
in awk itself. Since we don't need the memory in bytes anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1503331
Change-Id: I38d25406b84d0f70ed62101d5fb5ba108bcab8bd
(cherry picked from commit 00a6a016d5235de4cbde26cb40db71119967d3c7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/21/238421/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local mem=`echo -e "${queues}" | awk -v sum=0 '{sum+=$1} END {print (sum/1048576)}'`
deleted_lines: local m_b=`echo -e "${queues}" | awk -v sum=0 '{sum+=$1} END {print sum}'` local mem=$(( $m_b / 1048576 ))

commit_message:
Trivial locking cleanup in test_listener

ListenerSetupMixin.ThreadTracker was reading self._received_msgs
unlocked and sleep/looping until the desired value was reached.
Replaced this pattern with a threading.Condition.

Change-Id: Id4731caee2104bdb231e78e7b460905a0aaf84bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/59/236859/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.lock = threading.Condition() self.lock.notify_all() with self.lock: while self._received_msgs < expect_messages: self.lock.wait() tracker = self.trackers.setdefault(tracker_name, self.ThreadTracker())
deleted_lines: self.lock = threading.Lock() while self._received_msgs < expect_messages: time.sleep(0.01) tracker = self.trackers.setdefault( tracker_name, self.ThreadTracker())

commit_message:
Add translation to v2 shell

Add translation support for v2 shell help messages. It allows
to detect the messages that needs to be translated for translation
team.

Change-Id: Id1fb0355090d4e223d13c15100e6726e15563670

commit_message:
Import i18n functions directly

As stated in i18n guide it is normal to import i18n functions
(_, _LW..)  directly and we can include i18n functions in
hacking exceptions.
Also there is no need to make exceptions for six moves
because pep8 passes correctly without it.

Change-Id: I9c9aa490f1447bb7ae221809df7bc110c27d1336
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/19/228819/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from glanceclient._i18n import _
deleted_lines: from glanceclient import _i18n_ = _i18n._

Refactored tests to ease maintenance.

commit_message:
Switch cloud-init to absent to fix tests

This change updates the ensure on cloud-init to absent as purged is not
availble on all platforms. This will allow tests to pass cleanly on OSX
or other systems where purged is unavailable.

Change-Id: I43a40b79a022d4f6ed5ddb9479002461416fdea8
Closes-Bug: #1493985
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/79/235479/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ensure => 'absent',
deleted_lines: ensure => 'purged',

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Partial-Bug: #1259292
Change-Id: I86a496e640ceb9402dd2dde2be5281e358ca3592

commit_message:
Fix MetricWeigher to use MonitorMetricList

The commit I4dfbea27ce6c3eecc1a8658b1f9dc0feb2298705 changes
'HostState.metrics' to 'objects.MonitorMetricList'. But MetricWeigher
still use the old dictionary of 'host_manager.MetricItem'. This patch
corrects the behavior of MetricWeigher with related tests, and delete
unused MetricItem.

Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I7c98c2e189318e85a733f0287ef507c7bad36472
Closes-Bug: #1493680

commit_message:
Add microversion bump exception for scheduler-hint

It seems diffcult to manage schedulers on microversions, so this patch
adds it as an exception.

Change-Id: Ic86e5db39d3b3cd0ba1f182fd82a62cb98fb8075
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/42/221642/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - the list of attributes and data structures accepted. Example: adding a new attribute 'locked': True/False to the request body However the attribute ``os:scheduler_hints`` of "create a server" API is an exception in this case. New schedulers don't require a new microversion because available schedulers depend on cloud environments and we accept customized schedulers as the rule.

commit_message:
Pass CONF to logging setup

The function accepts two parameters, the first one being the
current CONF. The second parameter is the product name.

Closes-bug: #1505710

Change-Id: Id53214977f6ed87202c22314f7b864a9d0df8291
(cherry picked from 7668c794f8294b278e7f006d9594fd7653099bac)

added_lines: logging.setup(CONF, 'glance')
deleted_lines: logging.setup('glance')

subject: Spawn dedicated rpc workers for state reports queue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-12 12:27:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7d50b7018811a4790e9ae0b7188a50c6eca605b7', 'message': 'Spawn dedicated rpc workers for state reports queue

By default spawn one additional rpc worker to process
state report queue.
State report queue will also be processed by regular
rpc workers, but in case these workers are busy with
processing heavy requests, state reports queue will
automatically be consumed by dedicated rpc workers.

Closes-Bug: #1505217
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-15 15:25:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c56a0f13104725f7c5123636eda29beffae073ca', 'message': 'Spawn dedicated rpc workers for state reports queue

By default spawn one additional rpc worker to process
state report queue.
State report queue will also be processed by regular
rpc workers, but in case these workers are busy with
processing heavy requests, state reports queue will
automatically be consumed by dedicated rpc workers.

commit_message:
Spawn dedicated rpc workers for state reports queue

By default spawn one additional rpc worker to process
state report queue.
State report queue will also be processed by regular
rpc workers, but in case these workers are busy with
processing heavy requests, state reports queue will
automatically be consumed by dedicated rpc workers.

This change applies to ML2 plugin only.
Other plugins should implement start_rpc_state_reports_listener
to enable additional rpc workers.

Change-Id: I5f8df6a478f7c82382049274b34b07109eeafbdb
Closes-Bug: #1505217
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/05/233605/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # process state reports despite dedicated rpc workers def start_rpc_state_reports_listener(self): self._setup_rpc() self.conn_reports = n_rpc.create_connection(new=True) self.conn_reports.create_consumer(topics.REPORTS, [agents_db.AgentExtRpcCallback()], fanout=False) return self.conn_reports.consume_in_threads()

commit_message:
Ironic: Call unprovison for nodes in DEPLOYING state

This patch is making the Nova ironic driver to try to unprovision the node
even if it's in DEPLOYING state. Current Ironic will not accept aborting
the deployment when it's in DEPLOYING state but with the retry mechanism
it may work once the state is moved to ACTIVE or DEPLOYWAIT. Prior to
this patch the logic was to not even try to unprovision the node if it's
in DEPLOYING and just go ahead and clean the instance but that behavior
is dangerous and could leave orphan active instances in Ironic. With
this patch at least if the unprovision fails in Ironic we can make sure
that the instance won't be deleted from Nova.

The tests for the destroy() method were refactored to extend testing
destroy() being called with all provision state methods in Ironic
instead of picking certain ones; A helper function was created to avoid
code duplication on the tests.

Partial-Bug: #1477490
Change-Id: I227eac73a9043dc242b7a0908bc27b628b830c3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/57/209457/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(ironic_driver.IronicDriver, '_unprovision') def test_destroy(self, mock_cleanup_deploy, mock_unprovision, mock_node): node = ironic_utils.get_test_node(driver='fake', uuid=node_uuid) for state in ironic_driver._UNPROVISION_STATES: node.provision_state = state instance = fake_instance.fake_instance_obj(self.ctx, node=node_uuid) self.driver.destroy(self.ctx, instance, network_info, None) mock_node.get_by_instance_uuid.assert_called_once_with( instance.uuid) mock_unprovision.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, instance, node) mock_cleanup_deploy.assert_called_once_with( self.ctx, node, instance, network_info) # reset mocks for the next interaction mock_node.get_by_instance_uuid.reset_mock() mock_unprovision.reset_mock() mock_cleanup_deploy.reset_mock()
deleted_lines: def test_destroy(self, mock_cleanup_deploy, mock_node): node = ironic_utils.get_test_node(driver='fake', uuid=node_uuid, provision_state=ironic_states.ACTIVE) instance = fake_instance.fake_instance_obj(self.ctx, node=node_uuid) def fake_set_provision_state(*_): node.provision_state = None mock_node.set_provision_state.side_effect = fake_set_provision_state self.driver.destroy(self.ctx, instance, network_info, None) mock_node.set_provision_state.assert_called_once_with(node_uuid, 'deleted') mock_node.get_by_instance_uuid.assert_called_with(instance.uuid) mock_cleanup_deploy.assert_called_with(self.ctx, node, instance, network_info)

commit_message:
Add API schema for different_cell filter

For using the different cell filter, the API parameter different_cell
needs to be passed to the corresponding filter. However v2.1 API
validation denies it because there is not API parameter definition
and it didn't work at all.
This patch adds the API schema.

Change-Id: Ic61b9a18722b7701b09e71f3f3a547ad9e6363c2
Closes-Bug: #1492925
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/93/220893/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
